subtitle:
Choose naturally smoked haddock as the colour is subtle compared with artificially
coloured and dyed fish.

method.text: Place the haddock in a pan with the water and poach for about 5-6 min or until cooked through. Remove from pan with a fish slice. Discard skin and flake fish, removing any bones.
Mix together the rice, fish, egg, parsley, milk and nutmeg. Season well. Spoon the mixture into individual tins or ramekins and cover with foil.
Place the tins or ramekins in a roasting tin and pour in enough boiling water around the tins to come halfway up the sides. Cook in oven for about 30-40 min or until firm to the touch.
Meanwhile prepare the sauce. Place the pepper in the oven for about 10 min, turning occasionally until the skin splits. Remove from the oven, wrap in a tea towel and allow to cool.
Heat the oil and fry the onion until softened. Add the tomatoes and simmer for 5 min. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.

Peel the skin off the pepper and discard. Core and de-seed the pepper. Place the flesh in a blender with the cooled tomato mixture and process until smooth. Return the sauce to a clean pan. Stir in the vinegar and seasoning. Heat through.
To serve, turn out the Timbales on a bed of pepper sauce.

title: Haddock timbales with red pepper sauce
